mech.item.multimeter.lore_2: Shift+R-Click to edit machine's Grid ID.
mech.item.machine_upgrade.lore_1: Shift+R-Click on a machine to install.
mech.item.machine_upgrade.lore_2: Device must have a machine upgrade installed.
mech.block.machine_crafting_table.lore_1: Enables crafting advanced machines and items.
mech.block.teleporter.select_destination: Click on destination and enter ID:
mech.item.item_filter.lore_1: Right click on a chest with
mech.item.disc_end_of_the_world: Skeeter Davis - The End of the World
mech.text.manual.instructions: Click on section to quick jump to it.
mech.text.manual.title: - Title
mech.text.multimeter.id_tutorial:
To edit the grid id, use the command /trigger mech_gridid set [id]. 
Then Shift+R-Click on machines with the multimeter to change the id.
mech.advancements.mechanization.title: Mechanization
mech.advancements.machines.copper_ore.ti: It's Not That Easy, Bein' Green
mech.advancements.machines.tin_ore.title: Geology rocks!
mech.advancements.base.wrench.title: Tools of the Trade
mech.advancements.base.multimeter.title: Now I can Feel the Power ;)
mech.advancements.base.battery_1.title: Can you feel the power?
mech.advancements.base.battery_2.title: I only grow stronger...
mech.advancements.base.battery_3.title: Unlimited, Power!
mech.advancements.base.battery_q.title: This is safe, right?!
mech.advancements.machines.quarry.title: Dwarf, Dwarf, Dige- Dige- Hole.
mech.advancements.machines.grinder.title: More for the Dollar
Is it Hot in Here, Or is it Just You?
Create an MSS Terminal and never run out of storage space again
mech.manual.upgrades:
Basic Upgrade:
%s

Ender Upgrade:
%s

Nether Upgrade:
%s
mech.manual.cover.body:
Welcome to Mechanization! This book will guide you though the datapack, giving information on recipes, machines, items, and more.

  Datapack by ICY105
   Manual Version: 3
mech.manual.manual.body: If you lose your manual, you can craft a new one at a machine crafting table.
mech.manual.global_toc.title: Table of Contents
mech.manual.base_toc.title: Basics
mech.manual.getting_started.title: Getting Started
mech.manual.getting_started.body1:
1. First, make a %s at a normal vanilla crafting table. Using it, craft a %s and %s.
2. Next, gather some resources. You will need a good amount of %s to get started, as well as sand and wool.
mech.manual.getting_started.body3:
3. The first machines you need are a furnace generator, battery, and alloy smelter. A grinder and electric furnace may also be useful.
4. Every machine has a use, so make whatever will help you the most- and always remember to have fun :)
mech.manual.machine_crafter.body: The machine crafting table is used to create everything in Mech. It can be crafted at a vanilla crafting table.
mech.manual.copper_ore.body:
Common Ore
Y-Level: 24-64
Good conductor of electricity, used in most machines.
mech.manual.tin_ore.body:
Common Ore
Y-Level: 24-64
Strong metal, used in most machines.
mech.manual.titanium_ore.body:
Rare Ore
Y-Level: 1-16
Used in advanced machines and equipment.
mech.manual.uranium_ore.body:
Uncommon Ore
Y-Level: 1-24
Used to make fuel for nuclear reactors.
mech.manual.machine_frames.title: Machine Frames
mech.manual.machine_frames.body: Machine frames are crafting ingredients used in most machines. There are 3 tiers.
mech.manual.wrench.body:
Right click a machine to perform a function- usually rotates the machine but could change a setting.
Shift+Right click to safely break a machine.
mech.manual.multimeter.body1:
Right click a machine to see it's stats, like how much power it has stored.
Shift+Right Click a machine to set it's Grid ID.
mech.manual.batteries.title: Batteries
mech.manual.batteries.body1:
Batteries are the heart of the power system- not just storing power, but also transferring it between machines. As such, a battery is required to transfer power.
Right click a battery with a wrench to disable sounds & particles.
mech.manual.batteries.upgrade: Increases capacity and transfer rate by 25%%.
mech.manual.batteries.body2:
Capacity: 100,000 kJ
Rate: 100 kW
Range: 12 Blocks
mech.manual.batteries.body3:
Capacity: 350,000 kJ
Rate: 400 kW
Range: 16 Blocks
mech.manual.batteries.body4:
Capacity: 1,000,000 kJ
Rate: 1000 kW
Range: 24 Blocks
mech.manual.batteries.body5:
Capacity: 500,000 kJ
Rate: 1000 kW
Range: 16 Blocks
Quantum batteries on the same network share power across any range and through dimensions, like an ender chest.
mech.manual.relay.body1:
Rate: 600 kW
Range: 48 Blocks
Transfers power within a network at a large range, or between independent networks at a smaller range. Use a wrench to toggle modes.
mech.manual.relay.body2:
Transmission: Sends energy to machines.

Collection: Takes energy from generators.

Export/Import: Export takes energy from another relay set to import mode. Works between different networks.
mech.manual.upgrades.body1: Shift+Right click on a machine to upgrade. Upgrades are permenant and cannot be removed. Generally boosts a machine's power by a reasonable amount.
mech.manual.upgrades.body2: Machine must have a machine upgrade, and cannot have a nether upgrade to install. Generally boosts a machine's efficiency or range.
mech.manual.upgrades.body3: Machine must have a machine upgrade, and cannot have an ender upgrade to install. Generally boosts a machine's power, but at a cost.
mech.manual.networks.title: Energy Networks
mech.manual.networks.body1: To create a network, run the command "/trigger mech_gridid set <id>". Then, shift+right click a machine with a multimeter to set its ID. Batteries will only transfer energy to machines on that share an ID.
mech.manual.networks.body2: Energy networks are useful to create separate energy networks, or to protect your energy against thieves. You can move energy between separate networks with relays.
mech.manual.machines_t1_toc.title: Age of Machines: Tier 1
mech.manual.alloy_furnace.body:
The alloy furnace combines various metals into improved versions. All Tier 2 & 3 machines require these alloys.
Uses 30 kW
mech.manual.furnace_generator.body:
Creates power from normal furnace fuels- including buckets of lava.
Generates 12 kW.
mech.manual.electric_furnace.body:
Acts like a standard vanilla furnace, but uses energy as fuel.
Uses 20 kW.
mech.manual.grinder.body:
Processes ores into dusts, logs into planks, blaze rods into powder, bones into bonemeal, cobble into sand, stone into gravel, and gravel into flint.
Uses 60 kW.
mech.manual.grinder.nether: Smelts Output- ex. ores are smelted into ingots.
mech.manual.tree_feller.body:
Chops down 1x1 trees in front of the machine.
Uses 32 kJ/Operation.
mech.manual.block_breaker.body:
Acts as a sort of 'null' chamber that breaks any block inside. Cannot break hard blocks.
Uses 24 kJ/Block.
mech.manual.block_breaker.upgrade: Can break hard blocks (ie. ores and obsidian).
mech.manual.growth_accelerator.body:
Increases growth speed of crops on farmland on top of growth accelerator.
Uses 16 kW.
mech.manual.growth_accelerator.upgrade: Can now grow nether wart, beet root, and cocoa beans.
mech.manual.machines_t2_toc.title: Age of Machines: Tier 2
mech.manual.solar_panel.body:
Generates free power from sun/moon. Right click to toggle between solar and lunar mode.
Generates 1-10 kW depending on light level.
mech.manual.solar_panel.nether: +400%% power in high-light conditions, no power in low-light conditions.
mech.manual.bio_generator.body1:
Generates power using bio materials.
Generates between 4-240 kW based on how many unique items are provided.
mech.manual.bio_generator.body2:
4 kW: Cactus
4 kW: Melon Slice
8 kW: Sugar Cane
8 kW: Kelp
8 kW: Bamboo
12 kW: Sweet Berries
12 kW: Cocoa Beans
12 kW: Beetroot
12 kW: Potato
12 kW: Carrot
16 kW: Wheat
16 kW: Raw Cod
16 kW: Raw Salmon
mech.manual.bio_generator.body3:
16 kW: Pumpkin
16 kW: Apple
20 kW: Melon Block
20 kW: Nether Wart
20 kW: Raw Rabbit
20 kW: Raw Chicken
24 kW: Raw Beef
24 kW: Raw Porkchop
24 kW: Raw Mutton
24 kW: Mushrooms
24 kW: Chorus Fruit
28 kW: Fungi
32 kW: Hay Block
32 kW: Chorus Flower
mech.manual.quarry.body1:
Automatically mines an area designated with a fence boundary. Make sure the quarry is in the corner of the boundary and right click with a wrench.
Uses 64 kW
mech.manual.quarry.body2: Accepts boundaries up to 32x32. Works with any fence type.
mech.manual.auto_farm.body:
Havests and replants any crop in a 7x7 area.
Uses 48 kW
mech.manual.auto_farm.upgrade: Collects drops and places them on top of the auto farm.
mech.manual.auto_fisher.body:
Automatically catches fish and other goodies. Needs to be submerged in a 5x5x5 area of water.
Uses 48 kW
mech.manual.auto_fisher.upgrade: Requires 5 less water blocks to function.
mech.manual.item_reformer.body:
Repairs items using energy. Compatible with items that have custom durability.
*Note the enchanted book is a mending book.
Uses 128 kW
mech.manual.mob_grinder.body:
Kills any non-boss mob in a 5 block radius, dropping its loot.
Uses 48 kW
mech.manual.mob_grinder.upgrade: Collects dropped items and places them on top of the mob grinder.
mech.manual.mob_grinder.nether:
x2 drop rate
Decreases range to 2 blocks.
mech.manual.lava_fabricator.body:
Melts stone into lava over 45 secs.
Uses 256 kW
mech.manual.lava_fabricator.upgrade: Melts ice and snow in an 11x2x11 area above the fabricator.
mech.manual.super_piston.body: Acts like a normal piston, but can move tile entities and machines (ie. chests). There is also a sticky variant. The turn table rotates machines.
mech.manual.machines_t3_toc.title: Age of Machines: Tier 3
mech.manual.dim_generator.body1:
Generates power using various rare dimension-based items as fuel. Initially only accepts overworld items.
Generates 24 kW
mech.manual.dim_generator.ender: Accepts ender items as fuel. No longer accepts overworld items.
mech.manual.dim_generator.nether: Accepts nether items as fuel. No longer accepts overworld items.
mech.manual.dim_generator.body2:
15s: Blue Ice
20s: Prismarine Crystals
40s: Rabbit Foot
80s: Phantom Membrane
160s: Scute
240s: Nautilus Shell
500s: Music Disc
1000s: Heart of the Sea
2000s: Totem of Undying
mech.manual.dim_generator.body3:
4s: End Stone
8s: Purpur Block
40s: Ender Pearl
60s: Eye of Ender
80s: Dragon's Breath
250s: End Crystal
500s: Shulker Shell
2000s: Dragon Head
8000s: Elytra
mech.manual.dim_generator.body4:
4s: Nether Brick
10s: Soul Sand
40s: Magma Block
40s: Glowstone Dust
80s: Nether Quartz
80s: Blaze Powder
250s: Ghast Tear
500s: Wither Rose
2000s: Wither Skeleton Skull
6000s: Nether Star
mech.manual.disenchanter.body:
Removes enchantments from items and puts them into enchanted books. Requires books and lapis to operate.
Uses 2048 kJ
mech.manual.teleporter.body:
Teleports to another random valid teleporter. Initially can only teleport *to* the Overworld (ie. End->Overworld works).
Uses 1024 kJ
mech.manual.teleporter.upgrade: Enables dialing device to choose destination. Teleporter can be named in an anvil to indicate destination.
mech.manual.spawner_controller.body:
Controls a mob spawner, increasing minimum player range and decreasing the spawn cooldown.
Uses 64 kW
mech.manual.spawner_mover.body: Right click on a mob spawner to pick it up, then right click again to place. 1 time use.
mech.manual.nuclear.title: Nuclear Ascension
mech.manual.fuel_cells.title: Fuel Cells
mech.manual.fuel_cells.body: Source of fuel for the fission reactor. Needs to be refined in a centrifuge to at least 10%%. Higher refined fuels increase reactor heat faster.
mech.manual.centrifuge.body:
Refines fuel rods to increase their grade and recycles spent fuel. Insert items in the top of the centrifuge.
Uses 64 kW
mech.manual.control_rod.body: Put beneath a reactor and apply a redstone to start reducing the reaction rate. Remember when the rate is positive the reactor will still to heat up, even with a control rod active!
mech.manual.temp_observer.body: Outputs a comparator signal based on the temperature of the nearest reactor within 8 blocks.
mech.manual.rate_observer.body: Outputs a comparator signal based on the reaction rate of the nearest reactor within 8 blocks.
mech.manual.steam_turbine.body: Converts steam generated from reactors into usable power. Can only generate up to 50 kW, so multiple turbines are needed to convert all the steam.
mech.manual.fission_reactor.body: The heart of the fission reactor multiblock. Generates heat from fuel rods which is 'spread' into the cooling unit. Right click on top of the reactor to insert a fuel rod.
mech.manual.reactor_mechanics.title: Reactor Mechanics
mech.manual.reactor_mechanics.body1: Fission reactors have 2 stats: reaction rate (rate) and temperature (temp). You can think of rate as acceleration, and temp as speed. The reactor burns fuel to increase the rate, which in turn increases the speed. The higher the rate, the faster the temp
mech.manual.reactor_mechanics.body2:
increases. Higher temps can generate more power, but pass 2000°C and the reactor will explode!

Converting heat into steam requires a cooling unit. This consists of a 5x5 block grid around the reactor. The reactor
mech.manual.reactor_mechanics.body3: transfers heat into each adjacent block, which in turn transfer some heat to their adjacent blocks, convert some heat into steam, and then cools off some heat reducing the reactor's temp.
mech.manual.reactor_mechanics.body4:
The key to a good cooling unit is balancing exchange, steam production, and cooling for the reactor.
Blocks have different stats for each trait, see block charts on the next page.
mech.manual.reactor_blocks.body1:
Exchangers have high transfer rates, but no steam production.

       Transfer Cooling
Obsidian
            60°C   40°C
Block of Coal
            70°C   30°C
Block of Redstone
            80°C   20°C
Block of Quartz
            90°C   10°C
mech.manual.reactor_blocks.body2:
Boilers have high steam production, but no reactor cooling.

       Steam Transfer
Block of Iron
            25°C   75°C
Block of Gold
            50°C   50°C
Block of Emerald
            75°C   25°C
Block of Diamond
           100°C   10°C
mech.manual.reactor_blocks.body3:
Coolers have high reactor cooling, but no transfer rate.

          Cooling Steam
Snow Block
            10°C   10°C
Lapis Lazuli Block
            20°C   20°C
Ice
            30°C   30°C
Packed Ice
            40°C   40°C
mech.manual.gadgets_toc.title: Gadgets
mech.manual.xp_tank.body: Stores up to 40 levels of XP. When standing on the tank, if you have over 30 levels it will store XP from you. If you are under 30 levels, it will give you XP. It will also pick up nearby XP orbs.
mech.manual.charging_station.body:
Charges items that can store portable energy (ie. portable battery).
Charges at 128 kW
Machine Upgrade: charges at 256 kW
mech.manual.portable_battery.body: Stores up to 32,000 kJ for use with items/upgrades. Must be in the hotbar. Can be added to an item as an upgrade at the Tinker Table.
mech.manual.tinker_table.body: Adds upgrades to items. Put the upgrades in the middle slots then the item to be upgraded in the right slot. To remove upgrades, place the upgraded item in the left slot.
mech.manual.tools_armor.title: New Tools/Armor
mech.manual.tools_armor.body1:
Mech adds new tools/armor for some materials. These are crafted using the same recipe style as vanilla with their respective material.

Conductive Tools: speed of gold tools with the durability of iron.
mech.manual.tools_armor.body2:
Crystal Composite Tools: same stats as diamond, but with only 24 durability. Comes pre-enchanted with fortune/looting 5.

Copper Armor: Same armor as chain, but with extra armor toughness.
mech.manual.tools_armor.body3:
Tin Armor: Same armor as chain, but with +50%% durability.

Steel Armor: Same armor as diamond, but with extra armor toughness.

Structural Armor: Same armor as diamond, but with +50%% durability.
mech.manual.titanium_weapons.body1: Same as a diamond sword, but with +25%% durability. Can be upgraded at the Tinker Table.
mech.manual.titanium_weapons.body2:
Top to bottom:
+2 Attack Damage
-0.5Attack Speed
Poison
Wither
mech.manual.titanium_weapons.body3:
Top to bottom:
Weakness
Slowness
Vampiric
Glowing
mech.manual.titanium_tools.body1: Same as diamond tools, but with +25%% durability. Can be upgraded at the Tinker Table.
mech.manual.titanium_tools.body2:
Top to bottom:
Auto Smelt
Empowered (haste)
Magnetic
Trash
mech.manual.titanium_tools.body3:
Top to bottom:
Smash (stone mines in a 3x3 area)
mech.manual.titanium_armor.body1: Same as diamond armor, but with +50%% durability. Can be upgraded at the Tinker Table.
mech.manual.titanium_armor.body2:
Top to bottom:
+2 Armor
+1 Armor Toughness
+10%% Speed
+5 Health
mech.manual.titanium_armor.body3:
Top to bottom:
-50%% Knockback
Antidote
Auto-Eater
Night Vision
mech.manual.titanium_armor.body4:
Top to bottom:
Water Breathing
Slowfall
Flying
Shield
mech.manual.plasma_guns.body1: Each part is used to create a plasma gun. Parts are: barrel, magazine, stock, trigger.
mech.manual.plasma_guns.body2: Shoots plasma balls using energy. Guns are: SMG, Rifle, Pistol, Sniper.
mech.manual.plasma_guns.body3:
SMG 
Fire Rate: Very High
Damage: Low
Energy Usage: Low

Rifle 
Fire Rate: High
Damage: Medium
Energy Usage: Medium
mech.manual.plasma_guns.body4:
Pistol 
Fire Rate: Medium
Damage: Medium
Energy Usage: Low

Sniper 
Fire Rate: Low
Damage: High
Energy Usage: Medium
mech.manual.plasma_guns.body5:
Super Charger:
   +25%% Damage
Cryo Unit: -20%% Heat
Plasma Pump: +20%% ROF
Fluid Actuator:
   +20%% Velocity
mech.manual.gadgets.title: Gadgets
mech.manual.compresser.body:
Handles most 2x2 and 3x3 "compressing" recipes (ie. iron ingots -> iron blocks). Works with both vanilla and mech items.
Uses 16 kJ/Recipe
mech.manual.decompresser.body:
Handles most "decompressing" recipes (ie. iron block -> iron ingots). Works with both vanilla and mech items.
Uses 16 kJ/Recipe
mech.manual.stone_cutter.body1:
Handels most 'stone' based recipes (ie. stone -> stone bricks). See next page for complete list.
Uses 16 kJ/Recipe
mech.manual.stone_cutter.body2:
Stone -> Stone Bricks
End Stone
 -> End Stone Bricks
Diorite
 -> Polished Diorite
Granite
 -> Polished Granite
4 Prismarine Shards
 -> Prismarine
4 Sand -> Sandstone
4 Red Sand
 -> Red Sandstone
4 Brick -> Bricks
mech.manual.stone_cutter.body3:
4 Nether Birck
 -> Nether Bricks
4 Magma Cream
 -> Magma Block
4 Popped Chorus Fruit
 -> Purpur Block
Blackstone -> Polished Blackstone
Polished Blackstone -> Polished Blackstone Bricks
mech.manual.dye_machine.body:
Dyes any dyeable block in batches of 8. Dye goes in the top slot, the block in the bottom slot.
Uses 16 kJ/Recipe
mech.manual.fast_hopper.body: Transfers items x10 faster then a normal hopper.
mech.manual.ender_hopper.body: Picks up any item within 12 blocks.
mech.manual.item_transmittion.body1: Sends items from attached inventory to an item receiver within 16 blocks. Valid transmitters can be restricted using Grid IDs.
mech.manual.item_transmittion.upgrade: Can send to receiver over any range. Receiver must be loaded.
mech.manual.item_transmittion.ender: Can send to receivers in other dimensions. Receiver must be loaded.
mech.manual.item_transmittion.body2: Counterpart to the item transmitter. Cannot be upgraded or equipped with an item filter.
mech.manual.item_transmittion.body3: Shift+Right click on a chest to set contents of item filter. Right click on top of an item transmitter to attach filter.
mech.manual.storage_unit.body: Stores up to 2147483647 of a single, stackable item. Can only be interacted with via hoppers.
mech.manual.auto_jukebox.body: Plays a random music disc in its inventory when given a redstone signal. Legend speaks of special music discs that
mech.manual.mss_terminal.body:
Accesses storage drives housed in drive bays within 16 blocks. Switch between active drive with the arrows.
Uses 120 kW while active.
mech.manual.mss_drive_bay.body: Houses storage drives for access by Terminals.
mech.manual.mss_storage_drive.body: The physical item storage medium. Has 24 item slots, with each slot able to store 2147483647 items.
